original_question: What type of friction is friction that acts on objects when they are sliding over a surface?

What is the exact kind of friction acting on sliding objects?
How is the friction called that affects objects when they slide across a surface?
Will you identify the type of friction involved when objects skid over a surface?

What form of friction becomes active when an object is sliding on a surface?

What variety of friction is present when objects are made to slide over surfaces?

pred_ans: The type of friction that acts on objects when they are sliding over a surface is called kinetic friction.
pred_ans_conf_MCQ: The type of friction that acts on objects when they are sliding over a surface is kinetic friction
pred_ans_conf_OE: The type of friction that acts on objects when they are sliding over a surface is kinetic friction.
pred_diverse_ans: The category of friction experienced by sliding objects is called kinetic friction.
The exact kind of friction acting on sliding objects is kinetic friction.
The friction that affects objects when they slide across a surface is called "static friction".
Yes, I can identify the type of friction involved when objects skid over a surface.
The term that best describes the friction that falls upon objects while they're in a sliding motion is "kinetic friction".
The classification of friction that occurs when objects slide is called kinetic friction.
The type of friction that applies to an object sliding across a surface is called kinetic friction.
The variety of friction present when objects are made to slide over surfaces is called kinetic friction.
The type of friction experienced by objects during sliding is called kinetic friction.
